channel.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

image.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

channel.description: The latest international news from Sky, featuring top stories from around the world and breaking news, as it happens.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2021, Sky UK. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'Putin's war machine has broken': Ukraine will beat Russia, Boris Johnson tells Kyiv parliament
item.description: Ukrainian troops will beat their Russian counterparts and it will "be free" from occupation, Boris Johnson has told the country's parliament - adding that it is a fight of "good versus evil".
item.media:description: 03/05/2022. London, United Kingdom. Prime Minister Boris Johnson addressing the Ukraine Parliament. Prime Minister Boris Johnson addressing the Ukraine Parliament from No9 Downing Street. Picture by Andrew Parsons / No 10 Downing Street

item.title: Survivor describes 'animal fear' as Russian forces begin storming besieged Mariupol steelworks
item.description: Russian forces have begun storming the besieged Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol - as survivors reached safety and began to tell their stories.
item.media:description: Smoke rises above a plant of Azovstal Iron and Steel Works during Ukraine-Russia conflict in the southern port city of Mariupol, Ukraine May 2, 2022. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko

item.title: Surviving Azovstal - dozens evacuated from steel plant but will never escape the 'living hell' of Mariupol
item.description: The convoy arrives after many delays; the first thing we see is a police car, its lights flashing.
item.media:description: A woman is carried out of a bus with people who fled from Mariupol, Tokmak and Berdyansk as they arrive to a reception centre for displaced people in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine. Pic: AP/Francisco Seco

item.title: Extreme heatwave hits India and Pakistan triggering fire alerts and melting pavements
item.description: Blistering heat in India and Pakistan have left people "gasping" for air and forced India to row back on a policy to reduce coal imports to stave off further power blackouts.
item.media:description: A man and a boy walk across an almost dried up bed of river Yamuna following hot weather in New Delhi, India, Monday, May 2, 2022. An unusually early and brutal heat wave is scorching parts of India, where acute power shortages are affecting millions as demand for electricity surges to record levels. (AP Photo/Manish Swarup)

item.title: Helicopter catches falling rocket in mid-air before dropping it
item.description: A helicopter has caught a falling rocket before the crew was forced to drop it for safety reasons about 20 seconds later.
item.media:description: Rocket Lab has demonstrated the capture using a helicopter previously, although this was the first real-world test

item.title: The children living, learning and growing up in Kharkiv's underground metro station
item.description: Hundreds of children survive underground in Kharkiv, where they have been sheltering for two months in a city under constant attack.
item.media:description: Nicole Bulizhenko's parents are still living at their home in the city

item.title: 'Do not cover him again!': Morgue staff open body bag to find man alive inside
item.description: Workers at a morgue in Shanghai opened a body bag to find the man inside was still alive.

item.title: Man jailed for 1988 murder of American who fell from Sydney cliff known to be gay meeting place
item.description: An Australian man has been jailed for the 1988 murder of an American who fell from a Sydney cliff that was a known gay meeting place.
item.media:description: Scott Johnson (pictured) was killed in 1988 Re: Gay US student's killer jailed in Sydney after 30 years

item.title: 'Not acting himself': Mother of British aid worker captured by Russian forces denounces state TV interview
item.description: The mother of a British aid worker who has been shown handcuffed on Russian TV said he was "not acting in his natural way" during the interview.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect claims he has an alibi that can be backed up
item.description: The man suspected of abducting Madeleine McCann insists he was many miles from the scene having sex in his camper van with a young woman who will back his alibi.
item.media:description: Christian B has been informed he is now an 'arguido' in Madeleine's disappearance - a formal suspect
